member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.CopyData
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.CopyData method copies a subset of the path's data points to a PointF array and copies a subset of the path's point types to a BYTE array.
member.param: Pointer to an array that receives a subset of the path's data points.
Pointer to an array that receives a subset of the path's point types.
Integer that specifies the starting index of the points and types to be copied.
Integer that specifies the ending index of the points and types to be copied.
member.returns: This method returns the number of points copied. This is the same as the number of types copied.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.Enumerate
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.Enumerate method copies the path's data points to a PointF array and copies the path's point types to a BYTE array.
member.param: Pointer to an array that receives the path's data points.
Pointer to an array that receives the path's point types.
Integer that specifies the number of elements in the points array. This is the same as the number of elements in the types array.
member.returns: This method returns the number of points retrieved.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.GetCount
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.GetCount method returns the number of data points in the path.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the path.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.GetLastStatus
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.GetLastStatus method returns a value that indicates the nature of this GraphicsPathIterator object's most recent method failure.

returns.para: The GraphicsPathIterator.GetLastStatus method returns an element of the enumeration.
If no methods invoked on this GraphicsPathIterator object have failed since the previous call to GetLastStatus, then GetLastStatus returns Ok.

If at least one method invoked on this GraphicsPathIterator object has failed since the previous call to GraphicsPathIterator.GetLastStatus then GraphicsPathIterator.GetLastStatus returns a value that indicates the nature of the most recent failure.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.GetSubpathCount
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.GetSubpathCount method returns the number of subpaths (also called figures) in the path.
member.returns: This method returns the number of subpaths (also called figures) in the path.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.GraphicsPathIterator
member.summary: Creates a new GraphicsPathIterator.GraphicsPathIterator object and associates it with a GraphicsPath object.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that will be associated with this GraphicsPathIterator.GraphicsPathIterator object.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.GraphicsPathIterator
member.param: The object to copy to this object.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.HasCurve
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.HasCurve method determines whether the path has any curves.
member.returns: If the path has at least one curve, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.NextMarker
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.NextMarker method gets the next marker-delimited section of this iterator's associated path.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object. This method sets the data points of this GraphicsPath object to match the data points of the retrieved section.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the retrieved section. If there are no more marker-delimited sections to retrieve, this method returns 0.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.NextMarker
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.NextMarker method gets the starting index and the ending index of the next marker-delimited section in this iterator's associated path.
member.param: Pointer to an INT that receives the starting index.
Pointer to an INT that receives the ending index.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the retrieved section. If there are no more marker-delimited sections to retrieve, this method returns 0.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.NextPathType
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.NextPathType method gets the starting index and the ending index of the next group of data points that all have the same type.
member.param: Pointer to a BYTE that receives the point type shared by all points in the group. Possible values are PathPointTypeLine and PathPointTypeBezier, which are elements of the enumeration.
Pointer to an INT that receives the starting index of the group of points.
Pointer to an INT that receives the ending index of the group of points.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the group. If there are no more groups in the path, this method returns 0.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.NextSubpath
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.NextSubpath method gets the next figure (subpath) from this iterator's associated path.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object. This method sets the data points of this GraphicsPath object to match the data points of the retrieved figure.
Pointer to a BOOL that receives a value that indicates whether the retrieved figure is closed. If the figure is closed, the received value is TRUE; otherwise, the received value is FALSE.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the retrieved figure. If there are no more figures to retrieve, this method returns 0.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.NextSubpath
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.NextSubpath method gets the starting index and the ending index of the next subpath (figure) in this iterator's associated path.
member.param: Pointer to an INT that receives the starting index.
Pointer to an INT that receives the ending index.
Pointer to a BOOL that receives a value that indicates whether the obtained figure is closed. If the figure is closed, the received value is TRUE; otherwise, the received value is FALSE.
member.returns: This method returns the number of data points in the next figure. If there are no more figures in the path, this method returns 0.

member.name: GraphicsPathIterator.Rewind
member.summary: The GraphicsPathIterator.Rewind method rewinds this iterator to the beginning of its associated path.
